articles.title: KCNA Dismisses False Reports Released by Japanese Newspapers
articles.content:
KCNA Dismisses False Reports Released by Japanese Newspapers
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The Japanese newspapers Yomiuri Shimbun and Sankei Shimbun recently reported that the DPRK instructed its diplomats in foreign countries to be on standby for the possible "announcement of crucial measure." This is a whopping lie.
					The DPRK has never thought of making such an announcement nor issued any instruction concerning it.
					
					 What the Japanese newspapers reported is part of the despicable smear campaign conducted by Japan against the DPRK. 
					
					 What merits serious attention is that the two newspapers had temerity to let loose sheer sophism intended to hurt the dignity of the DPRK while talking about the "abnormal health condition" of the top leader of the DPRK. Lurking behind this is a sinister intention of the dishonest forces to defame the indestructible political system in the DPRK in which all the servicepersons and people are single-mindedly united around the party and the leader, displeased with it.
					
					 As already known well, the two newspapers are known to be typical reptile papers serving the Japanese ultra-right conservatives and have long played the role as media hatching plots against the DPRK in league with those forces hostile toward it. 
					
					 This time, too, those newspapers released articles peppered with lies and fabrications only to become a laughing stock of the world. 
					
					 This proves that Yomiuri Shimbun and Sankei Shimbun are made up of wicked money grabbers who do not hesitate to fake up articles about the health condition of the top leader of other country, not content with fabricating stories out of the greed for money.
					
					 The DPRK does not recognize the said newspapers as media as they are keen on breeding plots, bereft of any elementary press ethics, nor will deal with them.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK hold the prestige of their top leader dearer than their lives and will never tolerate any act of defaming it.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Nigerian Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Nigerian Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Zamfara State Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria led by its Executive Governor Alh. Mahmud Aliyu Shinkafi at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					Present there were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, and Yusuf Amuda Abubakar, Nigerian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nigerian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Zamfara State Government of Nigerian
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Zamfara State Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
					 Executive Governor of the state Alh. Mahmud Aliyu Shinkafi on a visit to the DPRK conveyed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today.

articles.title: Greetings to Acting President of Zambia
articles.content:
Greetings to Acting President of Zambia
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Rupiah Bwezani Banda, acting president of Zambia, on Oct. 21 on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message wished the Zambian government and people success in their efforts to consolidate the national unity and political stability and successfully push forward the plans for socio-economic development and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Zambia would continue to grow stronger in various fields in the future.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Peruvian PM
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Peruvian PM
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Premier of the Cabinet Kim Yong Il Oct. 15 sent a congratulatory message to Yehude Simon Munaro upon his appointment as Prime Minister of the Republic of Peru. 
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger in the future, too, the message wished him success in his work for the development of economy and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Qatari Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Qatari Ambassador
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Abdulla Abdulrahman Al Muftah, Qatari ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
					 Kim had a talk with the Qatari ambassador after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: FM Meets New Qatari Ambassador
articles.content:
FM Meets New Qatari Ambassador
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Abdulla Abdulrahman Al Muftah, new Qatari ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him today.

articles.title: MOU on Cooperation in Sports between DPRK and Myanmar Signed
articles.content:
MOU on Cooperation in Sports between DPRK and Myanmar Signed
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- A memorandum of understanding on cooperation in sports between the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission of the DPRK and the Ministry of Sports of Myanmar was signed at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were Pak Hak Son, chairman of the commission, and officials concerned from the DPRK side and members of the delegation of the Ministry of Sports headed by Minister Aye Myint from the Myanmar side.
					
					 The MOU was inked by Pak Hak Son and Aye Myint.

articles.title: Delegation of Lao Party Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Lao Party Leaves
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the party who is vice-prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Lao government, left here today after wrapping up its three-day-long visit to the DPRK.
					 During its stay in the DPRK the delegation visited Mangyongdae and the Tower of the Juche Idea and went round rooms for hobby groups of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace before enjoying an art performance of members of art groups of the palace.

articles.title: Art Troupe of Political Department of CPLA Air Force Here
articles.content:
Art Troupe of Political Department of CPLA Air Force Here
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The art troupe of the Political Department of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army headed by its Deputy Director Song Kun arrived in Pyongyang today for the performance of the Chinese modern dance drama "A song in praise of Hongmei."

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian Organization
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian Organization
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Syrian Trade Unions Federation.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by its President Mohammed Shaban Azzooz who is president of the World Federation of Trade Unions on a visit to the DPRK on Thursday.

articles.title: Day of Cuban Culture Marked
articles.content:
Day of Cuban Culture Marked
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- An art exhibition was opened at the Chollima House of Culture on the Day of Cuban Culture on Thursday.
					 Present there on invitation were Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, working people in the city and diplomatic envoys and staff members of embassies of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					On hand were Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The participants looked round art works depicting the natural scenery and structures of Cuba.

articles.title: Members of Russian Embassy Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Members of Russian Embassy Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin and staff members of his embassy Thursday helped farmers of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Kochang Cooperative Farm in Chollima County, South Phyongan Province in harvesting.
					 The guests helped farmers in rice threshing and handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: New Books Off Press
articles.content:
New Books Off Press
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House has recently brought out the picture album "Scenes of Celebrated Mountains of Korea" and the guidebook "Here Is Pyongyang".
					The picture album gives sceneries of celebrated mountains including Mt. Paektu, the ancestral mountain of Korea, Mt. Myohyang being proud of its superb scenic beauty, Mt. Kumgang famous as beautiful spot on the eastern coast, Mt. Chilbo called by "Mt. Kumgang in North Hamgyong Province", Mt. Jangsu, "Queen of Beautiful Valleys" and Mt. Kuwol of forests and mysterious rocks.
					
					The guidebook deals with the grand and beautiful looks of Pyongyang, the capital of the DPRK, with time-honored history which have been changed in the new century and its historical and cultural relics and remains.

articles.title: Source of Korean People's Confidence and Optimism
articles.content:
Source of Korean People's Confidence and Optimism 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The confidence and optimism of the Korean people in the victory of the socialist cause of Juche are getting stronger as days go by.
					They are the noble ideological emotion of revolutionaries who valiantly go through ordeals and difficulties, love the future and live an optimistic life with unswerving belief in the justness of the revolutionary cause and the inevitability of its triumph.
					
					The source of the Korean people's confidence and optimism lies in having General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the van of the revolution.
					
					Kim Jong Il, who has boundless loyalty and pure morality to President Kim Il Sung, leadership ability of solving all problems in proper combination of politics with military affairs, rare wisdom of far-sightedness and revolutionary sweep, has wisely led the army and people from many years ago in the efforts for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of the President.
					
					He with his prominent political caliber has always guided the Korean revolution to victory with the result that the DPRK has turned into the socialist country of Juche fully demonstrating the might of the independent national economy as a politically and ideologically strong nation and a military power and its people have enjoyed an independent life to their hearts' content with high pride.
					
					His Songun politics enables the Korean people to display fuller the honor of being the revolutionary people with confidence in sure victory and optimism.
					
					Another source of their confidence and optimism is found in having the tradition of self-reliance.
					
					The revolutionary spirit of self-reliance is a traditional fighting spirit of the Korean people and the invincible revolutionary spirit whose might has been proved through the historical course of the Korean revolution.
					
					Overcoming the ever-intensified moves of the imperialist reactionaries against the DPRK and multifold natural disasters, they have all along adhered to the revolutionary principle of Juche, the principle of self-reliance, under the Songun revolutionary leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea and victoriously concluded the "Arduous March" and the forced march, thus laying a solid foundation for leaping to the building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					They will, in the future, too, stubbornly strive to carry the Juche-oriented revolutionary cause to accomplishment with the unwavering belief that a rich and powerful socialist country will be certainly constructed as long as  Kim Jong Il stands in the van of the Songun revolution and there is the tradition of self-reliance.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Aso Regime to Make Switchover in Its Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Urges Aso Regime to Make Switchover in Its Policy towards DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The Aso regime's stand towards the DPRK is now drawing world attention.
					The present Japanese authorities are disregarding the impartial verification procedures in line with the phase of disabling nuclear facilities agreed upon between the DPRK and the United States and feel displeased with the issue of verification though it is enough to convince the international community for its reasonable nature and justice. 
					
					 The Aso government authorities were opposed to the verification method even before the DPRK was delisted as "a state sponsor of terrorism," asserting that "no concession should be allowed over procedures of verification of the nuclear program of north Korea." They are still sticking to the theory of "strict nuclear verification."
					
					As known to everybody, full understanding between the DPRK and the U.S. is the core of the issue of nuclear verification for denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula.
					
					It is by no means fortuitous that the U.S. State Department clarified that "it got considerable cooperation over the issue of verification."
					
					 The measure taken to cross the DPRK off the list of "state sponsors of terrorism" according to the agreement on the impartial verification procedures reached between both sides constitutes a very realistic step for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the region.
					
					This is a product of the principle of "action for action." That is why there is no ground to find fault with this. 
					
					 What Japan is now claiming under the pretext of "nuclear verification" glaringly reveals its present regime's stance towards the DPRK.
					
					 The successive Japanese ruling forces' hostile policy towards the DPRK, their chronic disease, has remained unchanged since its emergence and got more undisguised in its nature. 
					
					 Japan's negative attitude is a deliberate move to hamstring the implementation of the denuclearization of the peninsula.
					
					 In the past Japan adopted a "resolution" at the Diet urging the U.S. not to make haste in fulfilling the commitments under the February 13 agreement, asserting that the U.S. plan to take the DPRK off the list of "state sponsors of terrorism" would seriously affect the Japan-U.S. alliance.
					
					It is the wish of Japan to see the U.S. satisfying its taste, not wedded to the universally accepted understanding of peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of the Asia-Pacific region and international relations. Nothing is more impudent and brazen-faced than this attitude.
					
					 Japan can hardly be considered as a party to the six-party talks both in the light of what it has done at the talks so far and the insincere stance taken by it towards the fulfillment of its commitments under the agreement reached at the talks.
					
					 It is, indeed, preposterous for Japan to create complexities in the way of the talks, imprudently expressing a different opinion on the "nuclear verification."
					
					 The countries concerned still remember the hurdles laid by Japan to create complexities in the way of the talks. They are, therefore, cautious about the present Japanese government bringing to light its sinister intention, displeased with the current development.
					
					 Japan now deserves cool treatment for opposing the new "verification proposal" of the DPRK under the pretext of the "alliance." It is now running helter-skelter, left behind alone after the U.S. announcement of its above-said decision. 
					
					 The Aso regime seems to feel lonely as it is unable to foresee even a bit.
					
					If the Japanese politicians have even an iota of conscience, they had better be wise, though belatedly, not losing an opportunity to provide them with a favorable condition for making a switchover in the policy towards the DPRK. This would be a beneficial option for them.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Reckless Acts Flailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Reckless Acts Flailed
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Now the relations between the north and the south have reached the phase of acute confrontation, something unprecedented since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. This is entirely attributable to the Lee Myung Bak clique's acts of treachery to tide over its ruling crisis through the escalated moves for confrontation with the DPRK in utter disregard of the interests of the nation.
					 Rodong Sinmun today observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group has malignantly slandered the north-south joint declarations, describing them as "products of the strategy towards the south." This group has refused to implement those declarations, peddling such watchwords of anti-DPRK, anti-reunification confrontation as "no nukes, opening and 3,000 dollars," and is busy kicking up a whirlwind of confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 These traitors are now finding themselves in a pretty fix due to the people's massive resistance against the unpopular policy and feel fretful without knowing when a "time bomb" for candlelight actions will go off again.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is regarding the "security of its power" more important than national reunification and driving the inter-Korean relations to a collapse. This is a revelation of its criminal attempt to bring back the inter-Korean relations to those of acute confrontation in the past in a bid to divert elsewhere the resistance of various social circles and tide over the crisis.
					
					 The Lee group is also getting frantic with the moves to bring a nuclear disaster to the Korean nation, acting nuclear war servants for the U.S. imperialists. This is an unpardonable act of treachery perpetrated by those in the grip of a serious crisis.
					
					 There will be disastrous consequences if the above-said traitors are allowed to bring the dark clouds of a war of aggression against the north in collusion with foreign forces, while seeking "the security of power" regardless of the fate of the country and the nation and a nuclear disaster that may hit them. 
					
					 The successive treacherous ruling quarters of south Korea faced a stern judgment of history and people without exception for pursuing confrontation with the DPRK and anti-reunification policies, backed by foreign forces.
					
					 The Lee clique had better face up to the reality and behave with discretion and stop at once the treacherous acts of sacrificing the interests of the nation under the pretext of the "security of power," warns the commentary.

articles.title: Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Minister of "Unification" Flayed
articles.content:
Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Minister of "Unification" Flayed
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean minister of "Unification's" assertion that the inter-Korean relations deteriorated due to the north's demand for the implementation of the October 4 declaration is sheer sophism intended to turn white to black and a brazen-faced and despicable attempt to shift the responsibility for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations onto the north. 
					 Minju Joson Thursday says this in a signed commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 As already publicly known, the blame for the deadlocked inter-Korean relations entirely rests with the Lee Myung Bak group. 
					
					 Citing the demeanor of Kim Ha Jung as an example, the commentary notes:
					
					 As soon as he was appointed to the above-said post, Kim called for "adjusting the speed, scope and modality for the development of the inter-Korean relations" depending on the "progress made in the settlement of the nuclear issue." He blustered that "the Kaesong Industrial Zone should not be expanded unless the nuclear issue is solved." 
					
					What extent his idea of confrontation with compatriots has reached is well illustrated by the fact that he refused to attend an event for commemorating the first anniversary of the publication of the Oct. 4 declaration but made his appearance at a "ceremony commemorating the Day of the 'ROK' Army."
					
					It is the unanimous wishes and aspiration of all compatriots to thoroughly implement the said declaration whose validity and vitality have been proved in practice in order to further develop the inter-Korean relations and achieve the independent reunification and peace and prosperity.
					
					 No matter what a spate of sophism Kim dares try to lay the blame for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations at the door of others, no one will be taken in by it. His outbursts will only touch off the resentment of the nation and precipitate his own self-destruction.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group will not be able to go scot-free after going frantic with the racket of confrontation with the north, behaving contrary to the people's mindset and swimming against the trend of the times. The group will have to pay a dear price for their crimes.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday dedicates a signed article to the anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Firmly Defend the Political and Ideological Unity and Purity of the Party Generation after Generation". 
					 The work published on Oct. 22 Juche 65(1976) clarifies the theoretical and practical issues arising in strengthening the unity and cohesion of the Party, a crucial issue in carrying out the cause of socialism that has gone on generation after generation.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il a monolithic system of leadership was firmly established in the Party and all its members were fully prepared as Juche-type revolutionaries and a revolutionary trait of advancing the revolution and construction only as required by the Juche idea prevailed throughout the country amidst the gigantic struggle for modeling the whole party on the Juche idea in the 1970s when the above-said work was published, the article says.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the unity and cohesion of the Workers' Party of Korea have exceptionally grown stronger at a new higher level in the era of Songun, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It was thanks to his Songun leadership that the revolutionary character of the WPK as the party of President Kim Il Sung has been invariably preserved and there prevailed throughout the Party a revolutionary trait of thinking and acting as required by the Juche idea, the Songun idea. 
					
					 The WPK is demonstrating its dignity as a revolutionary party which has attained the unbreakable unity and cohesion in thinking and purpose and formed a harmonious whole with the popular masses after taking deep roots among them. This is the brilliant fruition of the great Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The political and ideological position remained strong and the spirit of the socialist red flag prevailed throughout the society despite so stern trial during the "Arduous March", the forced march because the Party, the headquarters of the revolution and the heart of society, was pervaded with the Juche idea, the Songun idea.
					
					 The imperialists have been frantic with the reactionary ideological and cultural poisoning and psychological warfare against the DPRK. They, however, can never break the unity and cohesion of the WPK and the revolutionary ranks in thinking and purpose which have grown strong for several decades.

articles.title: Anniversary of Formation of Pro-Reunification Organization Observed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anniversary of Formation of Pro-Reunification Organization Observed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- An event was held in Seoul on Oct. 19 to mark the 8th anniversary of the formation of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration of south Korea.
					On hand were members of the solidarity and their families and personages of political parties and civic and public organizations.
					
					Speakers at the event condemned the Lee Myung Bak group for escalating the suppression of forces of the pro-reunification movement under the pretext of "security,"  letting loose without hesitation such outbursts calling for confrontation with compatriots as "the society can not advance even one step without eliminating the pro-north leftist forces."
					
					 They declared that the Lee "government's" fascist suppression of the camp of the pro-reunification patriotic movement is little short of an open negation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and a declaration of a war against the people keen to achieve reconciliation, peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					They denounced the group of traitors for intensifying the crackdown upon the solidarity after labeling it "an organization benefiting the enemy, acting at the instruction of the north." 
					
					This reality requires the people to defend and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and wage an all-out struggle for bringing an era of people's sovereignty to this land, they held. 
					
					They declared that the organization would surely foil the present regime's "case of an organization of the solidarity for actions" and plots to get the above-mentioned declarations scrapped.
					
					They called upon the people from all walks of life to vigorously turn out in the struggle against the anti-reunification Lee "government" swimming against the trend of the June 15 era of reunification.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries expressed support to the struggle of the Korean people to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation at the events held on the occasions of the 63rd founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 82nd anniversary of the formation of the "Down-with-Imperialism Union."
					The general secretary of the Brazilian National Federation of Industrial Workers in his address at an event said that the Korean people have achieved shining victories in the building of a new country and the Fatherland Liberation War under the leadership of the WPK and have firmly defended Korean-style socialism pulling through difficulties and trials under the uplifted banner of Songun. He expressed hope that the Korean people would achieve fresh successes in building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, united close around General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The governor of a county of Guinea expressed belief that the Korean people would surely reunify the country in the near future and fling the door open for a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under the banner of Songun.
					
					 The governor of the Administration of the southern region of Moscow in his speech at an opening ceremony of the Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition sincerely wished the Korean people greater success in their struggle for building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation.
					
					The chairman of the Pribram County Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia noted that the Korean people are united close around the Party and the leader politically and ideologically and in the sense of moral obligation, and upholding their leadership.

articles.title: Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported
articles.content:
Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland－Korea Committee issued a statement on Oct. 10 on the occasion of the month of the support for the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK).
					 Recalling that President Kim Il Sung set forth the above-mentioned proposal on Oct. 10, 1980, the statement pointed out that this proposal is the most realistic and fair and aboveboard one as it indicates the way of achieving the reunification of Korea by the federal formula based on one nation, one state, two systems and two governments.
					
					 Explaining the detailed contents and validity of the proposal, the statement went on:
					
					 The main contents of the above-said proposal are reflected in the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The DFRK must be a neutral and non-aligned state which is not affiliated to any bloc and does not allow the presence of troops of any other countries and the establishment of their military bases in its own territory.
					
					 The U.S. should withdraw its forces from south Korea and put an end to the interference in the internal affairs of the Korean people.
					
					 The Korean people's struggle for the reunification of the country which had advanced under the banner of "By our nation itself" has encountered difficulties since the pro-U.S. conservative Lee Myung Bak regime emerged in south Korea.
					
					With no force can the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad ever arrest or frustrate the dynamic struggle of the Korean people to drive the U.S. troops out of south Korea and independently and peacefully reunify the country.
					
					The founding of the DFRK provides a sure guarantee for peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the Asia-Pacific region.

articles.title: ATCC rechaza versiones fraudulentas de periodicos japoneses
articles.content:
ATCC rechaza versiones fraudulentas de periodicos japoneses
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, los periodicos japoneses "Yomiuri Shimbun" y "Sankei Shimbun" informaron que nuestro pais dio la orden de espera a los diplomaticos acreditados en otros paises en visperas de supuesto "anuncio importante".
					Estas versiones se tratan de un embuste de punta a cabo y un sucio complot.
					
					 No hemos pensado nunca en ese anuncio ni dado ninguna indicacion por el respecto.
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que los dos rotativos censuraron perversamente la dignidad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea difundiendo atrevidamente el "rumor de la anormal salud" de nuestra Direccion Suprema. 
					
					 Detras de esto esta el intento de las fuerzas malvadas de mellar el regimen coreano disgustadas de la solidez de este en que todos los militares y habitantes estan unidos monoliticamente en torno al partido y al lider.
					
					 Como ya es conocido, desde hace mucho tiempo, esos periodicos, connotados medios pagados por el circulo conservador derechista de Japon, cumplieron el papel de antros de complot anti-RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas hostiles a esta.
					
					 Esta vez tambien ellos fueron ridiculizados por el mundo por sus articulos plagados de mentiras y embustes.
					
					 Lo que hizo a "Yomiuri Shimbun" y "Sankei Shimbun" publicar esa informacion inventando hasta el problema de la salud de la Direccion Suprema de otro pais es la insaciable sed por el dinero.
					
					Esto demuestra que estos medios estan integrados por los mezquinos esclavos del dinero. 
					
					No consideraremos como organos de prensa a ellos, que se dedican solo a las intrigas sin la mas elemental etica de prensa, ni tendremos ningun contacto con ellos.
					
					 El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea aprecian mas que su vida el prestigio de su Direccion Suprema y no perdonaran ni en lo minimo los actos para desvirtuarlo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador de Katar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador de Katar
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Abdulla Abdulrahman Al Muftah presento este jueves en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario del Estado de Katar en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim Yong Nam departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il envia mensaje a su homologo peruano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il envia mensaje a su homologo peruano
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo de la Republica Peruana Yehude Simon Munaro, con motivo de su nombramiento a este cargo.
					El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose en futuro tambien y le desea al destinatario exitos en su labor para lograr el desarrollo economico y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Firmada nota de entendimiento entre Corea y Myanmar
articles.content:
Firmada nota de entendimiento entre Corea y Myanmar
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricada este jueves en esta capital una nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion entre el Comite de Direccion de Deportes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Ministerio de Deportes de la Union de Myanmar.
					 En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el presidente del Comite de Direccion de Deportes, Pak Hak Son, y otros funcionarios, y por la otra, los miembros de la delegacion del Ministerio de Deportes presidida por su ministro Aye Myint.
					
					 Pak Hak Son y Aye Myint suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: ATCC califica a Japon de quejon solitario
articles.content:
ATCC califica a Japon de quejon solitario
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ATCC) -- En estos dias, llama atencion la posicion del Poder de Aso hacia Corea.
					Las actuales autoridades japonesas desprecian el imparcial procedimiento de verificacion conveniente a la etapa de neutralizacion de las instalaciones nucleares acordado por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos mostrandose disgustadas de esta misma labor cuya racionalidad y justeza son suficientes para convencer a la sociedad internacional.
					
					Aun antes de la borradura de la RPDC de la lista de los "paises que apoyan el terrorismo", las autoridades del gobierno de Aso se opusieron al metodo de verificacion insistiendo en "no hacer concesiones en la tramitacion de verificacion del programa nuclear del Norte de Corea" y tambien en la actualidad se obstinan en la teoria de "consecuente inspeccion nuclear".
					
					 Como ya es conocido, el suficiente entendimiento entre la RPDC y EE.UU. deviene lo clave de ese asunto para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Al respecto, el Departamento de Estado norteamericano comento que "ha conseguido una cooperacion considerable en cuanto a la verificacion".
					
					 La adopcion de la medida de excluir a la RPDC de la lista de los "paises que apoyan el terrorismo" segun el acuerdo arriba mencionado deviene realmente un paso adelante para la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region.
					
					 Este producto del principio "accion vs. accion" no lo puede cuestionar nadie.
					
					 La actitud tomada hoy por Japon bajo el pretexto de la "verificacion nuclear" refleja patentemente la posicion de su actual poder hacia Corea.
					
					La politica hostil a la RPDC, enfermedad cronica de los sucesivos gobernantes japoneses, no cambio ni en lo minimo sino se hace mas brutal despues de la aparicion del poder de Aso.
					
					La actitud negativa de Japon es una maniobra malintencionada para obstaculizar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 Anteriormente, Japon habia aprobado en la dieta el "proyecto de resolucion" que exige a EE.UU. no apresurar el cumplimiento del deber correspondiente al Acuerdo del 13 de Febrero advirtiendo que el plan norteamericano de eliminar a Corea de la lista mencionada tendria graves influencias en las relaciones de alianza bilateral.
					
					Este pais isleno sigue siendo hasta hoy el cinico y atrevido que demanda a otros actuar conforme a su gusto sin hacer caso a la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto de la region de Asia y el Pacifico ni a las normas generales de las relaciones internacionales.
					
					 Tanto a la luz de su conducta de hasta ahora en las conversaciones a 6 bandas como en vista del cumplimiento de sus compromisos segun el acuerdo alcanzado en esta cita, no se puede considerar Japon como participante en este dialogo.
					
					Es muy ilogico que tal pais estuviera complicando las cosas presentando su disenso sobre la "verificacion nuclear".
					
					 Hasta la fecha, los paises interesados no olvidan las complicaciones creadas en el proceso de las conversaciones a 6 partes por las maniobras obstructoras de Japon y toman precaucion de que el actual gobierno japones expresara abiertamente su mal genio por la evolucion actual de la situacion.
					
					Al publicarse la medida de EE.UU. de tachar a la RPDC de la lista referida, Japon, que rechazaba la nueva "propuesta de verificacion" de la segunda, se cayo del tren en que viajan todos los demas y se quedo solito.
					
					 Esto es un castigo merecido al pais isleno.
					
					 El gabinete de Aso esta buscandose su aislamiento por su corta y torpe vision politica.
					
					Si los politicos japoneses tuvieran un poco de juicio, deberan actuar con inteligencia aunque fuera desde ahora sin perder la oportunidad para el cambio de su politica hostil a la RPDC. 
					
					 Esto le sera una opcion util.
